She thinks dinosaurs continue to fascinate us because they are unknown and remind us that there is still so much to discover. Palaeontology is a way for us to travel back in time and learn more about the world.

When you're going on a car trip with your family, you know you're not there yet, even if you keep asking 'Are we there yet?' The truth is, when you finally get there, it's not 'there' anymore, it's 'here'. So, you should ask 'Are we here yet?' instead.
As a child, you might feel bored on long car trips. You can watch DVDs, listen to music, or do puzzles while looking out the window at the scenery. Your parents will help you with things like getting snacks or changing the radio station. But sometimes, your sibling might do something annoying, like put their foot on your side of the seat. This can lead to a fight, and your parents will have to separate you.
To deal with this, my dad has a funny trick. When I ask 'Are we there yet?', he says 'Yes, we're here. Get out of the car!' But then I say 'But we're still on the highway!' and he says 'Oh, maybe we're not there yet.' This makes everyone quiet for a while.
You know you're finally 'there' when your parents get out of the car and go away from you. So, if your parents are still near, the answer to your question is 'no, you're not there yet'.

John and Zuzi Morgan have opened a café in Oxford where people can enjoy a cup of coffee, cake, and play board games. They want people to have a good time and come back again. Zuzi says they wanted to create a place where people can be together and talk, because everyone is too busy with their phones and gadgets. They like a type of game called Eurogames, which are not too complicated and have gentle themes like farming and building. One popular game is called Pandemic, where players work together to solve problems. The game designer, Matt Leacock, was inspired by another game called Lord of the Rings. He wanted to create a game where everyone feels good, whether they win or lose.
Leacock has always loved board games, but as a child, he got frustrated because the games were too hard or too boring. So, he started designing his own games with the help of his uncle. Pandemic was a big success, and the next version was even better. It has a lot of storytelling and is like an electronic game, where you create your own characters and the game changes as you play.
The growth of video games has actually helped board games become more popular. More people are playing games on their phones, and this has made them more open to playing board games with others. Some people missed playing games with friends and family in the same room, so they started looking for alternative ways to play together. John and Zuzi's café is a place where people can do just that. Playing games has become a way to connect with others in the real world, and this trend is likely to continue.

Jamie Scott is a successful songwriter and producer in the music industry. He believes that perseverance and hard work are essential for success, even when things don't go as planned at first. His mother was a good singer and taught him how to play the guitar. He grew up listening to music from a local radio station that played old songs. He didn't hear a contemporary song until he was 12 years old.
When he was 12, he had to choose between playing tennis and music. He played tennis at a high level, but he didn't enjoy it as much as music. He spent his lunch breaks at school playing the piano and writing songs.
At 17, Jamie left school to pursue a career in music. He formed a duo with a friend who was a good guitarist, but they didn't share the same passion for performing. Jamie's parents told him he had 18 months to make it as a performer or he would have to get a job.
After a few close calls with record labels, Jamie was signed to a music publisher at 19. However, the labels only wanted him as a solo artist, so he had to split with his friend. It took him a while to find success, but he eventually became a successful songwriter and producer.
Jamie believes that writing for other artists is where he found his true calling. He helps launch the careers of up-and-coming artists by writing songs that are likely to be successful. He's honest about his goal of writing huge hits and doesn't apologize for it. He just wants to write the best songs possible and make them popular.

Tony Connor is a famous bike rider who does amazing stunts. He is known as a'street trials cyclist' because he jumps from one place to another, often from high places like roofs or walls. He films his stunts and puts them on the internet. When I met him, I was surprised by how good he is. He's very brave, creative, and willing to take risks. When he explains what he's going to do, I often think it's impossible, but he always manages to do it. After he finishes a stunt, I tell him how amazing he is, but he seems not to care. Despite being famous, Tony doesn't like the attention. He prefers to focus on his riding rather than talking about it. He says that he's grateful for the technology that helps him make a living from his hobby.
Tony has to be very brave to do his stunts, and he knows that some people think he's reckless. He says that they don't understand the sport and don't realize that he takes advice from experts to make sure he's safe. Tony is not careless about the risks he takes. He knows that some people are scared of taking risks, and that's okay. He's in the group that feels scared but finds a way to overcome it. He spends a lot of time planning and preparing for his stunts, and he knows he can't let his nerves get the better of him.

In the UK and other countries, there is a growing trend to encourage students to get involved in research as early as possible in their studies. This is because research is not just for famous professors or scientists. It's a natural way to learn and develop skills. Research skills are useful not only in your studies but also in your future job. As a student, you contribute to knowledge by asking questions and finding answers. You don't just memorize information; you create it.
Research is about asking questions like "Why?", "How?", "What does this mean?", and "What if?". It's about thinking critically and not just accepting what others tell you. You need to question what you read and hear, and think about whether it's logical and backed by evidence.
Many students already do research in their daily lives, such as finding out how to fix things or find the right music system. In college and university, you're expected to think critically and construct your own knowledge. You might need to question established knowledge and authorities, but this is an important part of learning.
It's important to engage with what you read and think about it critically. Don't just take information at face value. Instead, test it out, identify biases, and think about whether it's logical and backed by evidence.

Cities have always been important places for learning and creativity. Think of the old coffee shops in London where people discussed new ideas, or the art studios in Paris where Pablo Picasso talked about his art. However, city life is not always easy. The same coffee shops that inspired people also spread diseases. Picasso eventually moved to the countryside. The modern city can be a place of great creativity, but it can also be very stressful and overwhelming.
Scientists are now studying how cities affect our brains. They have found that city life can make us less clever, sometimes very quickly. One reason for this is that cities have very little nature. Studies have shown that patients in hospitals recover faster if they can see trees from their windows. Even just looking at nature for a short time can improve our thinking.
This is important because most people now live in cities. Instead of living in the countryside, we are surrounded by millions of strangers in concrete buildings. In recent years, it has become clear that living in cities has a big impact on our mental and physical health. It can even change how we think.
Imagine walking down a busy street and having to pay attention to many things at once. This can be very tiring. Our brains are like powerful computers, but using them to pay attention takes a lot of energy. Natural places, on the other hand, don't require as much mental effort.
This idea is called attention restoration theory. It was first suggested by a psychologist named Stephen Kaplan. He thought that spending time in nature could help our brains recover from the stress of city life. Natural places have many things that capture our attention, but they don't make us feel anxious or upset. This allows our brains to relax and recharge.
Before scientists discovered this, philosophers and architects were warning about the problems of city life and looking for ways to include nature in cities. Parks like Central Park in New York City are important places where people can escape the stress of city life. Spending time in a park can even improve our brain function.
So, why do cities continue to grow? And why do they remain important places for learning and creativity? Recent research suggests that the same things that make cities stressful can also make them creative. The many social interactions in cities can lead to new ideas and innovations. Just like the crowded coffee shops in 18th-century London led to new ideas, the crowded streets of 21st-century Cambridge, Massachusetts, contribute to its success as a center of technology. The key is to find ways to make cities less stressful while still keeping their creative benefits.

Where is the mind? This might seem like a strange question. We often think that thinking happens inside our heads. And we have special machines that can show us what's going on in our brains. But I think we should look beyond our skin and skull to understand the mind. There's a lot of evidence that shows that things, not just our brains, are important for our thoughts and feelings.
In the past, people used objects like stones, shells, and clay to help them think and solve problems. These objects were an important part of their lives and helped them make decisions. So, I think that what's outside our heads is still a part of our mind.
Most of what we know about the mind comes from studying people in special labs. But this can be limited because it doesn't show us how our minds work in everyday life. I'm not saying that our brains aren't important, but I think we should look at how our minds work with the things around us.
I have a new idea called Material Engagement Theory (MET). It says that our minds are connected to the things we use every day. For example, when we hold a stick, our body thinks it's part of us. This helps us understand how our minds work and how they change over time.
Think about a blind person using a stick. Where does their self begin? It's like their stick is a part of them. This shows us that our minds can change and adapt to new things. Our minds are like a project that's always being updated.
We've been using technology to help us think and solve problems for a long time. From stones to smartphones, these tools have helped us understand the world and ourselves. I think we should look at how these tools have changed our minds and how they will continue to change in the future.

Photography has changed the way we live and understand the world. In the United States, it became an important part of everyday life, from science and technology to art and entertainment. Historians say that photography is the country's most significant contribution to the visual arts.
So, why was photography so popular? Firstly, it was a new technology that matched the country's enthusiasm for innovation. Just like the invention of the steam engine, railroads, and electricity, photography made it easier to communicate and travel. It brought the world to people's living rooms, making it feel more accessible and exciting.
Secondly, the camera was a way to capture a person's image and share it with others. In the United States, people believed that individuals and national identities were constantly changing and needed to be reinvented. Photography was a way to do this.
Thirdly, the camera helped people create and share memories of their families. It was a way to record their history and create a sense of identity.
Photographs are unique because they are a record of what was in front of the camera. They are objective, but also subjective, as they are taken by a person with their own perspective. This makes photography a universal language, but also complex, as the meaning of a photograph can change depending on the context in which it is seen.
Photography has become an essential part of art, and many artists use it in their work. In fact, it is now an integral part of how we understand representation in art.

William James, an American philosopher and doctor, defined psychology as the'science of mental life' in 1890. This definition is still helpful today. We all have a mental life, and we know what it means to some extent. However, it's difficult to understand because it can be studied in humans, animals, and even rats. James thought that human psychology is made up of basic things like thoughts, feelings, and a physical world. Each of us knows things through our own thoughts, feelings, and experiences. This knowledge is personal and private. We can make judgments about psychology using our own experiences, but this can be tricky. 
When we talk about complex psychological topics, like whether brainwashing works or why people behave in certain ways, we are acting like amateur psychologists. However, this can lead to problems when people have different opinions. Professional psychologists try to find the most likely explanations for a situation. They help us distinguish between what is true and what is just our own opinion.
Psychologists don't fully understand how the brain works, so they study behavior instead. They make educated guesses about what's going on inside us based on what they observe. It's hard to study the brain directly, so they have to infer what's happening by looking at behavior. 
The goal of psychology is to understand the mind and behavior. It's like solving a crossword puzzle. Psychologists gather clues, analyze them, and make logical conclusions. They use scientific methods to study complex interactions and develop theories. Psychology can help us understand our experiences and make conclusions that can be applied to real life. It has helped us in many areas, such as teaching children to read, designing safer machines, and helping people who are upset. 
Psychologists have been studying psychology for about 150 years. Early psychologists tried to understand the mind by thinking about their own experiences. However, this had limitations. Today, psychologists prefer to study the behavior of others and base their theories on careful observations.

In a warehouse in Michigan, USA, there's a strange collection of products that didn't sell well. It's like a museum of failed products. The owner, Carol Sherry, thinks each product has its own sad story behind it. The most surprising thing is that this museum is a successful business. Many companies don't keep samples of their failed products, but the people who visit this museum are proof that it's not common.
The museum's owner, Robert McMath, started collecting products in the 1960s. He wanted a reference library of consumer products, not just failed ones. But, surprisingly, most of the products he collected didn't sell well. This is because most products fail. Today's culture is very focused on success, and companies often spend a lot of money on products that won't sell. They might even pretend that the product is still worth it, just to save face.
This focus on success is also seen in the self-help industry. Some people believe that if you imagine something will happen, it will. But a scientist named Tali Sharot has found that people tend to be too optimistic about their chances of success. In fact, people who are well-balanced might have a worse understanding of their abilities than those who are depressed.
A psychologist named Gabriele Oettingen has studied how thinking about the future affects people's motivation. She found that thinking about how well things could go actually makes people less motivated to achieve their goals. On the other hand, people who believe that ability can be developed through hard work and challenge are more likely to see failure as an opportunity to learn.
Psychologist Carol Dweck thinks that our experiences of failure depend on what we believe about ability. Some people think that ability is fixed and can't be changed, while others believe it can be developed. People who think ability is fixed are more likely to be upset by failure, while those who think it can be developed see failure as a chance to learn and grow.

Playing at home can give sports teams an advantage, but why is this? Some people think it's obvious, but things are changing in sports. Scientists and people who make money from sports are asking questions. They want to know what makes players play their best. Some scientists think that playing at home makes players feel more comfortable and confident. Others think that the crowd's noise and cheering can affect the referee's decisions.
In the past, playing at home was a big advantage. But now, with better travel and better hotels, it's not as big of an advantage. Some sports, like basketball, have a bigger home advantage than others, like baseball.
One reason for the home advantage might be that players feel more connected to their teammates when they play at home. They know each other's moves and can work together better. This makes them feel more confident and able to win.
Another reason might be that players feel a sense of pride and protection when they play at home. They want to defend their "turf" and win in front of their own fans. This can make them play more aggressively and try harder.
Some research has shown that players' testosterone levels are higher before home games. This could be because they feel a strong connection to their home stadium and want to defend it.
Overall, the home advantage is not just about the crowd or the players' comfort. It's about the team's connection and the players' sense of pride and protection.

Gary Player, a famous golfer, said "The more I practice, the luckier I get." But what did he really mean? He was being ironic, and his real message was "The more I practice, the better I get." But is this true? Can anyone become good at something just by practicing? Some people think so, but others disagree.
A psychologist named Anders Ericsson said that with 10,000 hours of practice, anyone can become an expert in any field. Many books have been written about this idea. However, a new book by Epstein argues that this is not always true. He says that scientists often only look at successful people and try to figure out why they are successful. But what about people who are not successful? What makes them different?
Epstein travels around the world to find answers. He talks to athletes, coaches, and even sled dogs! He learns that sometimes, people's natural abilities can affect their success. For example, some people might be naturally good at sports, and no amount of practice can change that. Epstein also looks at how gender and race affect athletic performance. He asks questions like "If practice is the only thing that matters, then why do we separate men and women in sports?"

Many children in wealthy countries feel unhappy and lonely. A book by Jay Griffiths says that this is because they spend too much time indoors, staring at screens, and don't get to spend time in nature. She thinks this is the main problem. This idea is similar to what other experts have said about childhood.
A study talked to some children to learn more about why they are unhappy. The children didn't say they wanted more gadgets; many said they would be happier if they could go outside more. Many adults also remember their own childhoods fondly, saying they had more freedom and spent more time playing outside. However, they didn't think about how they are now protecting their own children, keeping them safe and indoors.
Jay Griffiths' book has some good points. She talks about how parents' fears for their children's safety are used to sell toys and games to keep them indoors. She also writes about how some schools are prescribing medicine for children who are restless, or making them wear goggles for playground games.
Griffiths is passionate about giving children more freedom and allowing them to take risks. She thinks children need to experience some danger to learn how to manage it. However, she doesn't say how we can achieve this. Some people might also wonder if all children want to be free and take risks, or if some prefer to stay safe and calm.

I'm a psychologist who studies how children learn and grow. I believe that school doesn't always teach the most important skills. Most problems in life can't be solved with formulas or memorized answers. They require good judgment, wisdom, and creativity. These skills come from life experiences, especially play.
All mammals, including humans, play when they're young. Children play more than any other young animals because they have the most to learn. Play helps children develop important skills like thinking creatively, getting along with others, and controlling their emotions.
These skills can't be taught in school. They are learned through play. Children need to play freely to develop these skills. Adults, including geniuses, retain their playful minds and creativity throughout their lives.
Unfortunately, schools have become too focused on rules and grades. Children don't have as much free time to play as they used to. We need to give children more freedom to play and explore so they can grow into strong, confident adults.

Many young people in their twenties are using social media to look for a job. Sites like Twitter and LinkedIn allow them to connect with potential employers directly. However, this also means they can make mistakes. A young job seeker in the US contacted a marketing executive on LinkedIn, thinking she could help him get a job. But the executive was angry and sent a harsh rejection message that went viral. This incident shows that social media can be a dangerous tool for job hunters who don't know how to use it.
For many young people, social media is a part of their daily life. They use it to connect with friends and family, share photos and updates, and show off their interests. But when it comes to using social media for professional networking, it's different. It's not just about being popular or having a lot of friends; it's about being professional and respectful.
Some young people may not understand this difference. They may think that because they have a lot of friends on Facebook, they can just send a message to someone they don't know and expect a response. But this is not how it works. When using social media for professional networking, you need to be clear about who you are and what you can offer. You should also be humble and respectful in your approach.
Employers often complain that young job seekers on professional networking sites come across as arrogant or over-familiar. This can hurt their chances of getting a job. To avoid this, it's important to be professional and respectful in your online interactions. Remember, social media can be a great way to make useful contacts, but it needs to be used carefully.

Newspapers are in trouble. Since 2000, many UK national newspapers have lost a third to half of their readers. In the US, a research centre says that newspapers are now the main source of news for only 26% of people, compared to 45% in 2001. Some people think that newspapers will disappear in the next 15 years. However, old media have a habit of surviving. For example, theatre survived the newspaper, cinema, and television. Radio and vinyl records have also made a comeback.
Newspapers were once new media, and it took time for them to become popular. This was because producing news for a large number of people over a wide area was difficult and expensive until the 19th century. People used to think that everything stays the same, but now we expect change. In the past, people only needed news when something big happened, like a famine or a flood.
Journalism as a job is a recent development. Before the 19th century, people didn't need news on a regular basis. Now, with the internet, we can get news whenever we want and personalize it to our interests. We can also correct mistakes quickly and access documents easily. However, many news providers focus on being the first to break the news and creating drama, rather than helping us understand the world.
Perhaps newspapers will disappear, or perhaps they will find a new way to guide us to wisdom and understanding in this chaotic world.

If humans were meant to live in the dark, we would be happy to go without light at night. But we're not nocturnal creatures. Our eyes are adapted to see in the daylight. This is something that is deeply ingrained in our genes. We don't often think about it, but it's the reason we've changed the night. We've filled it with light. This is like controlling a river. It has its benefits, but it also has negative effects, known as light pollution. Light pollution is caused by bad lighting design. It shines too much light into the sky, which is not what we need. This washes out the natural darkness and affects many living things, including us.
In the past, people didn't have as much light pollution. Imagine walking in London at night in the 1800s. It was a much darker city. Most people used candles, torches, and lanterns for light. Only a few houses had gas lights, and there were no streetlights. From far away, you would have smelled the city more than seen it. We've lit up the night like it's an empty country, but it's not. Many animals are nocturnal, and light is important to them. Some birds are even attracted to artificial light and can get trapped. Light pollution can also affect our bodies. We need darkness to stay healthy. It's as important as light is. If we don't get enough darkness, we can get sick. Our bodies are used to the natural rhythm of day and night, and messing with that can cause problems. We've lost our connection to the natural world and our place in the universe. We've forgotten how small we are compared to the stars and the Milky Way.

A big company has decided not to keep track of how many holidays its employees take. The idea came from an email from the company's founder's daughter. She wrote that she likes to take as many holidays as she wants and never worries about the work. The company's founder thinks this is a good idea, but some people are not so sure.
The problem is that the company is very big and has many different departments. It's hard to know if taking a holiday will affect the work. The founder says that employees can take as many holidays as they want as long as they make sure their work is done. But it's hard to be sure that everything is okay before you go on holiday. And even if you try to tie up all the loose ends, there is always more work to come back to.
Taking too many holidays can make people feel guilty and stressed. They might feel like they are not doing their job properly. And if everyone takes holidays at the same time, it could cause problems for the company. Some people might not take holidays at all, or they might only take them when they really need to.
The company's founder thinks that this policy will make people more productive and happy. But some people are not convinced. They think that having unlimited holidays is not a good idea and that it could cause more problems than it solves.

'Scientific research papers are reviewed by other experts in the same field before they are published. This is meant to ensure that the papers are accurate and reliable. However, this process can take a long time - up to a year. Some people think that this is a good price to pay for trustworthiness, but others disagree.
The way research is published is changing. Some scientists are now posting their papers online before they are reviewed. This is called a preprint. This way, other scientists can read and comment on the paper quickly, and the author can make changes before it is officially published.
The current system of publishing research papers has some problems. Some scientists are more interested in getting their work published in a famous journal than in sharing their findings with others. This can lead to mistakes and biases in the research. The reviewers also have a hard time doing their job because they have to decide not only if the paper is good, but also if it is good enough for a specific journal.
Some scientists think that preprints could be a solution to these problems. They allow for quick sharing and discussion of research, and the author can still publish the paper in a journal later. This way, the focus is on the research itself, not where it is published.
A professor of psychology agrees. She posted a paper that criticized another paper, and she was able to get feedback from many scientists. She thinks that preprints could help to make the scientific process more open and transparent.'
I minimized changes to the factual content while simplifying the language and structure to make it more accessible to a B1 level learner. I also removed some technical terms and jargon to make it easier to understand.

When I ask my students what a poem is, they often say it's a 'painting with words'. But I'm not satisfied with their answers. So, I asked them to write two paragraphs about an object. The first paragraph should describe the object in a scientific way, like a scientist would. The second paragraph should be from the point of view of the object itself, and should be titled 'Poem'. One student wrote about an oxygen mask, which is not a typical choice. This helped us understand how poetry is unique.
When I was at school, I didn't understand poetry. I thought it was confusing and got in the way of understanding and feeling. After school, people rarely read poetry because it's not like other writing. Poetry is different from prose because it's short and often doesn't make sense at first. But we still try to read it because we want to find deep feelings, beautiful images, or clever ideas. We look for poems to be emotional, beautiful, or funny. But we can find these things in other things too, like films, articles, or music.
So, what is a poem? Some people think it's like a machine or a wild animal. But these comparisons don't work well. Instead, trying to define a poem makes us think about what we mean by machine or wild animal. Poetry is like a special object that can change our minds and make us see things in a new way. It's like a song that gets stuck in our heads. A poem can be powerful, even though it's just words on a page. It's different from other writing because it's not meant to be a commodity. It's a product of writing and rewriting, but it's unique and special.

I bought my first metal detector after I got married. It was a lot of money, but my wife, Marion, was impressed when I found a gold ring on my first outing. Over the years, I've found many other things that have given me pleasure. But it wasn't until 40 years later that I made another discovery that impressed Marion as much as the gold ring. It was a rainy day and I had a few hours to spare. I decided to search a spot I knew that had old farming equipment. My metal detector beeped, and I dug down half a meter to find a golden ball. As I brushed away the dirt, it became clear that it was a beautiful, intricately patterned loop. I knew it was something special. It was the Great Torc, a famous necklace from over 2,000 years ago. I took it home and showed it to Marion. We were both very excited. We knew we had to report it to the authorities, so I took it to the council office. They authenticated it and sold it to the British Museum. The money we got was split between the owner of the field and me. The torc is now in the British Museum in London. People ask me if I'm going to stop detecting now that I've made such a big find. But I love finding things, and I'll keep doing it as long as I can.

When I travel, I love sleeping. But I don't talk about it much because I feel a little guilty. When my friends tell me about their busy trips, with lots of planned activities, I smile and don't say much. But my own travel plans include taking long naps in the afternoon and sleeping in late in the morning. I think that's one of the best things about traveling.
I remember when I went to Mexico's Yucatán coast when I was in my early 20s. I slept a lot, over 12 hours a day. It was nice to sleep so much, even with noisy birds outside my window. I felt relaxed and my sleep was very good.
I think sleep is an important part of traveling. When we travel, we see and experience new things, and our sleep helps us process all those new things. Sleep is also different in different places. For example, when I went to Trinidad, people woke up early, slept a lot in the middle of the day, and then went out again in the evening. It took me a few days to get used to this new sleep pattern.
I also like sleeping in new places because I remember my dreams and the sounds and smells of the place. It's like I'm still experiencing the place even when I'm asleep. Some people think that sleeping is a waste of time, but I think it's an important part of traveling.
I'm going to stop feeling guilty about sleeping a lot when I travel. I'll tell my friends that sleeping is an important part of enjoying my trips.

Mia was helping a customer try on hats in her shop. The customer was looking at a medium-sized hat with a silk bow. Mia thought it was a good choice, but the customer didn't agree. She wanted a hat that would make her stand out at her daughter's wedding. Mia showed her a red and black hat, and the customer liked it. Mia was happy to help her find the right hat.
After the customer left, Mia thought about her own daughter, Jen, who was turning 30. Mia was looking forward to celebrating with her family and meeting Jen's friend, Tattie. Mia's husband, Jeff, was a bit skeptical about Tattie, but Mia thought she sounded nice.
Mia had started her own business, Mia's Hats, four years ago. She had converted an old barn into a showroom where women could try on hats and find the perfect one for their special occasions. Mia's business was very successful, and women came from all around to visit her.

Lawrence Okoye is a 21-year-old from London who has had an amazing journey in sports. He went from competing in the Olympic discus final to trying out for an American football team. He's never played American football before, but he's doing well and might be picked for a top team.
Lawrence is still learning about his new position and what he needs to do. He's never played American football before, but he's good at it. He was ranked the world's fourth-best discus-thrower just 20 months after starting to train.
Lawrence went to Atlanta for warm-weather discus training, but he also thought about playing American football. He applied to the NFL trials in Atlanta, even though he had never played the game before. He didn't get nervous, even when he was competing against men who had been playing the game their whole lives.
Lawrence did well in the tests and drills and was picked out as the most impressive player. He's not sure if he'll be selected, but he's not worried. He's used to people saying he's good at things, and he knows that hard work will help him succeed.
Lawrence has had some setbacks, like coming last in the Olympic discus final. But he's moved on and is focusing on his new goal. He's not worried about the money he could make as an NFL player - over $400,000 a year - because he knows he can always go back to the discus if it doesn't work out.
Lawrence thinks it's okay to try new things and take risks. He's always been a bit of a risk-taker, and he's happy to see where this new journey takes him.

I woke up on the plane and looked out the window. I saw a vast, empty landscape with brown and green colors. It was September, but it was still not autumn in Siberia. I saw no signs of people and the view went on forever. I shook my head. My neighbor, Sergei, woke up and smiled at me. He was a salesman from Moscow who was going to sell safety clothes to mining companies in a very remote area. He spoke little English, but we used a dictionary to talk. I told him I was going to Magadan, a city in eastern Siberia, but I only had a one-way ticket. I wanted to ride my bike back to England. Sergei was surprised. 'But there's no road from Magadan,' he said. I told him I thought there was a road, but not many people used it. He asked if I was going alone. I said yes, but I would have a friend, Al, with me. Sergei looked unsure. I showed him my warm clothes and told him I was prepared for the cold. But I didn't mention that I was on a tight budget. I had bought most of my clothes and equipment cheaply. I wasn't sure if they would be good enough.
I had met Al in a lecture hall in Scotland. The room was full of students, but they were all tired. Our teacher was talking, but I was thinking about a problem. Should I ask him something or not? I wrote a note to Al, asking if he wanted to cycle across the Karakorum Highway between Pakistan and China. He said yes. It was six years later that I was going to join Al in Siberia. I was a geography teacher, but I was still learning. I had two long holidays a year, which I used to go on adventures. I had met Al twice before, and he had become more adventurous. He had decided to cycle around the world. He was setting himself big challenges and overcoming them. I envied him because he was having an amazing adventure and proving that he could do things that seemed impossible.

The Red Bull Air Race is a competition where 12 pilots fly their planes through a course with tall pylons. They go fast - up to 370 km per hour! I got to try it out. Before the flight, I had to sign two forms and promise to stay calm and focused. I also had to promise to relax when I was flying upside down and enjoy the view.
When we were ready to take off, I felt a bit nervous. The pilot, Dario, told me to keep my eyes on the horizon and not touch anything. But I was worried and my mind was racing. It's hard to relax when you're flying so fast and doing crazy turns and loops.
As we took off, Dario banked the plane sharply to the right. I felt my stomach drop and my heart race. We flew upside down and I felt like I was going to pass out. But Dario told me to relax and look up. I saw some fields below and felt a bit better.
After 10 minutes, the flight was over. It was a lot of fun, but also a bit scary. Dario said it was a "soft" flight compared to what the real pilots do in the competition. He even ate a sandwich after we landed! I didn't eat for hours and that night I had a hard time sleeping because I kept thinking about the flight.

Doug Allan films animals in cold places. He's a famous wildlife cameraman who has worked on many TV shows. He loves extreme cold temperatures, like -18°C. Doug used to be a marine biologist and commercial diver. He learned how to survive in cold places while diving.
Doug's big break came when a TV crew asked him to help them film a documentary in Antarctica. He loved being a wildlife cameraman because it combined his passions for travel, adventure, and the underwater world.
When Doug started out, not many people had filmed in Antarctica before. He became known as the "cold man" and got to capture amazing footage of polar bears and other animals.
The technology for filming was very basic when Doug started 35 years ago. It's much easier now, with digital cameras and editing software. Doug says that in the past, you had to plan carefully and shoot less because film was expensive.
Doug has a lot of experience filming in cold places and knows how to stay safe. He's filmed in places with no mosquitoes, no diseases, and no leeches. He loves the Arctic and has spent a lot of time on sea ice.
Wildlife filming can be challenging, with many failures and embarrassments. Doug once got confused about the type of birds he was filming. Recently, he spent 23 days filming polar bears in the Arctic, but only saw one mother bear and her cub. On the 24th day, he finally got some amazing footage of a polar bear.
Doug wants to make a new documentary about climate change in the Arctic, talking to the people who live there and showing the impact of climate change on their lives. He thinks he could make an incredible documentary.

Pen Hadow is a brave and adventurous person. In 2004, he became the first person to walk to the North Pole alone. He had to swim in very cold water, fight against frostbite, and protect himself from polar bears. Just eight months later, he walked to the South Pole too. Now, he is going back to the Arctic again for an even bigger adventure.
This time, Pen will walk 1,000 kilometers to the North Pole with two friends. They will take measurements of the ice to help scientists understand how global warming is affecting the polar region. This will be the most accurate picture of what is happening to the ice.
Pen was trained to be brave and strong as a child. His father's old nanny, who used to work with a famous explorer, would send him out into the cold and snow with almost no clothes on. Pen's father loved adventure, and Pen grew up to be very strong and able to handle the cold.
Pen is married to Mary, who is also very adventurous. She loves horses and helps Pen with his polar guide business. Pen is worried about being away from his family this time because he knows his children are growing up and he doesn't want to miss important moments.
Pen and his team will be in the Arctic for three months. They will be supported by a group of six people who will bring them supplies. Pen is feeling a bit nervous because he knows this will be a big challenge. He is also worried about being 47 years old and not feeling as fit as he used to be.
Pen believes that his mission is important because it will help scientists understand the impact of global warming on the Arctic. He thinks that his skills as an explorer are now more important than ever, and he is excited to be able to make a difference.

I took a break from being an Olympic athlete. I wanted to do different things, like writing and TV work, and talk to businesses and schools. But I missed the excitement of competing. I decided to enter marathons and triathlons to stay in shape. Then, I received an invitation to row across the Atlantic with a TV presenter named Ben Fogle. I loved rowing and missed the feeling of gliding on the water. I asked some of my rowing friends if they wanted to join the race, but they weren't interested. I thought about joining the race with Ben, but I knew it would be hard to win with him. However, I also thought it would be fun to be the underdog and not have any pressure.
Ben had already paid for the boat and equipment, which cost £70,000. We talked about the costs and how we could make it work. I also had to think about the money I would lose by being away from home for a while. As a retired athlete, I make money by speaking at business conferences, but I find it hard to talk about my past achievements without having a new goal. Rowing across the Atlantic would be a new challenge and something I could talk about.
I learned a lot while preparing for the race, but one thing I realized was to appreciate the easy life I had as a full-time athlete. My training was tough, but it was planned and I had support from doctors and dieticians. I was worried about people's reaction to me racing with a TV presenter, but my concerns went away as we prepared. The Atlantic Rowing Race is not just about rowing; it's also about mental toughness. Ben had done some tough challenges before, but he didn't have much experience with rowing. I had to be patient and help him improve, but I should have realized he would need a lot of help when I agreed to race with him.

I left my job in London and moved to Finland to work with huskies in the Arctic Circle. I was 26 years old and wanted to escape the noise and crowds of the city. I found a company in Finnish Lapland that takes tourists on dog sled rides through the snow and ice. They had six dogs at first, but soon had over 100. I could join the team for three months, but they warned me that the work would be hard and the conditions would be tough.
I flew to Finland and was given a list of 100 husky names to memorize. I was feeling stressed and overwhelmed, so I looked out the window instead. On the bus ride to the farm, I saw dark forests and snow-covered trees. When I arrived, I was given a pair of boots and told to go outside. The dogs were excited and barking loudly. I followed the sound and saw people harnessing the dogs to sleds. I was told to get in and we set off into the dark.
It didn't take long to learn how to drive the sled, but I struggled with simple tasks like feeding and watering the dogs. It was hard to do these tasks in the cold weather, and I had to make a special soup for the dogs because their water would freeze. After my first week, my head was spinning with instructions and my muscles were sore from carrying heavy sleds. But I was proud of myself for learning new skills, like chopping wood and using a circular saw, in the snow.

On the day of the race, Paula Radcliffe finished quickly. Journalists were surprised because her time was good enough to qualify her for the men's marathon at the world championships in Paris. They asked her about a special oil, emu oil, that helped her heal from an injury. Radcliffe got hurt when she accidentally ran into a bike while training. Olympic champion Cathy Freeman recommended the oil.
Radcliffe didn't think her achievement was a big deal at the time. She and her team didn't set limits for themselves. They believed in the motto "no limits." During the race, Radcliffe's coach and physiotherapist were in a car, listening to the radio. They were worried that she was going too fast and might get tired. But Radcliffe kept going. With 800 meters left, she realized she could finish in under 2 hours and 16 minutes if she ran fast. She did, and finished in 2 hours and 15 minutes.
People were surprised that Radcliffe, who didn't run smoothly, could beat the East African runners. Radcliffe's physiotherapist, Gerard Hartmann, worked with her for weeks, helping her recover from her injuries. He said she was one of the most dedicated athletes he had ever worked with. Radcliffe's hard work paid off, and she set a record that no one has beaten. Many women started running long distances because of her.

When I first made my cooking show "In Search of Perfection", I was worried about how people would react. I thought that my approach to cooking, which included history, nostalgia, and science, might be too different from what people were used to. But my fears were unfounded. The show was a success, and it led to many other exciting projects, including a book about my restaurant.
In each of my projects, I like to think of myself as going on a journey, whether it's into the past, into people's minds, or into cooking techniques. I wrote several books called "Perfection", each one linked to a TV show of the same name. These books took me on a journey around the world, meeting people who are passionate about their work, like a man who makes the best pasta in the world.
Perfection is a personal thing, and it's hard to agree on what it means. Even choosing which dishes to include in my show was a challenge. Some people might ask, "Where's steak and kidney pie?" But after a long meeting, my team and I came up with a list that everyone could enjoy.
I believe that perfection is a mix of emotions, memories, and surroundings. My book isn't about claiming that my recipes are the best, but about understanding what makes them work. The TV show gave me the chance to try new foods, meet new people, and explore my own memories and nostalgia. I was excited to search for the best ingredients and try out new techniques, like making ice cream from scratch or cooking chicken in a hospital machine.

We were driving to Marrakech when our van broke down in a field. John got out to look at the engine. He stood there for a long time, looking serious. 'I don't know what I'm doing,' he said finally, and he and Mum started laughing. Bea was worried. 'We can't stay here forever,' she said. The field was empty, just grass and flowers. 'No, we can't stay here forever,' I repeated, because I didn't want to upset Bea.
We got back into the van and waited for John to find someone who knew how to fix the car. Mum lay down on the grass and asked me to tell her a story. I told her about two birds I had heard talking the day before. I told her about what they said about breadcrumbs and the weather. But Bea didn't believe me. 'That's silly, no one understands bird language,' she said. I felt sad and my eyes started to sting. John came back with three Moroccan boys who helped us push the van to a hotel. Bea didn't want to get out, but the boys didn't mind. They waved and smiled at her through the back door.
We went into the hotel café for tea. It was a nice place with a shady garden. The tea was sweet and made from mint leaves. We stayed there all day while John tried to fix the car. 'I'm glad it made it this far,' he said when it started to get dark. Mum made a bed for us on the road, and we slept there. The next day, John said we would have to have the van towed to Marrakech. We rode in a truck behind the van, and I wondered how we would get home again. I thought maybe we could take a boat to London. Then I fell asleep.

Lucy was talking to two other pianists at a party in a hotel ballroom. They were both older than her and good at speaking English. They talked about the music they played, where they had been, and where they were going next. Lucy told them she was going to a big music festival in the summer. The man from Tokyo was surprised. Lucy didn't want to go to this festival, but her mom had signed her up without asking her. Lucy's dad gave her a special necklace to celebrate, and her little brother was excited to hear about it. Lucy's teacher took her out for dinner to help her choose some music to play. But Lucy didn't really want to be there. The man from Tokyo asked Lucy how old she was, and she said 15. The woman from the other city said "Wow". Lucy didn't mean to brag, but it can be hard to know when to talk about her accomplishments. Lucy's grandfather came over and took her away from the conversation. He said not to get too friendly with the other pianists, because they are all competition. Lucy didn't think they were her competition, but her grandfather said everyone is. After the party, Lucy's grandfather told her she did well and that people were talking about her. Lucy liked being someone important, even if some people were jealous or thought she was too young.

'My dad said I spend too much time online and should get out more. I decided to look at what experts say. Most teenagers who use social media have many friends, a good sense of who they are, and learn important technical skills. Simon Miles, an expert on online safety, says social media is a normal part of modern life for teenagers. It's not good or bad, it just depends on how you use it.
Jim Matthews, a social media analyst, says social media is like a virtual youth club. It helps teenagers make friends, share jokes, and talk about their interests. It's a way for them to develop their identity and learn to deal with problems.
Psychologist Professor Keith Davidson says social media can help teenagers find their identity. They can share their interests and see that others have different opinions. Research shows that people who use social media a lot are not as selfish as those who don't.
Professor Andrew Phillips says social media can be helpful for quiet people who have special interests. They can connect with others who like the same things. Pauline White, an expert on digital education, says teenagers can use social media to find new interests, join groups, and create their own content. This can help them in their future careers.
She thinks social media is becoming a creative force. Teenagers are making videos, podcasts, and blogs about things they like. They can share photos and learn from others. This can help them in the workplace. Every business uses social media to sell and promote their brand, so it's important to understand how it works.'

When most people think of a family vacation, they usually don't think of a big road trip across several states in the US and a province in Canada. But my parents didn't want a relaxing holiday. They planned a big adventure for our summer vacation. My dad seemed to think it was a good idea to take us on a trip that most people don't do anymore. My brother and I were not happy about it.
We packed our car with suitcases, coolers, and lots of clothes. We set off on a two-week road trip across the country. I was excited, but I knew I would miss my privacy. We drove west through Oklahoma and had some exciting adventures. We stopped for the night in a small town under the stars, but we almost got blown off the road in a dust storm. We learned that cows have the right of way on the road.
The next day, we kept driving. We saw the desert, mountains, and beautiful landscapes. We visited the Great Sand Dunes and Pagosa Springs in Colorado. We smelled sulfur in the air and saw ancient and modern things everywhere. We had to drive carefully to avoid construction traffic.
We visited Yellowstone National Park and saw bears and other wildlife. We had to wait for them to cross the road, and we even had a close encounter with a bear. We stayed in a old hotel with no internet or phone signal, but it was worth it for the amazing views. After a rainstorm, we headed back south. My parents were right - you don't have to go to a foreign country to have a great adventure. It was nice to be home again, and I didn't fight with my brother for 100 hours on the road. I took a lot of photos and will always remember the unexpected things that happened on our trip.

Rose Frost is 16 years old and will live with her grandmother, Daisy, for a while. Her parents are separating and her father is going to work abroad. Her mother will join him, but Rose and her older sister Amy will stay in England. Amy will finish her school year and live with the college head. Rose will live with her grandmother, who she doesn't know very well. Rose's parents didn't want her to live with her grandmother at first, but Daisy insisted. Rose's memories of her grandmother are happy, but she doesn't know why her parents don't like her.
Rose's grandmother is a social person who likes to invite people to dinner and go out. Rose is excited to live with her because she will have more freedom. She wants to be able to play music loudly, invite friends over, and go out without asking permission all the time. Her parents gave her a new phone with a camera in case of emergencies. Rose and her grandmother agreed that they will trust each other and communicate openly. Rose has always been a responsible student and has good grades. She will start a new school in five weeks and make new friends. This will be her fourth school in five years, but she is excited to start her final two years of school.

Charlotte Grainger wrote a book when she was 15 years old. Her teacher at school thought she might write a book when she was older, maybe 30 or 40. But Charlotte wanted to try. She started writing when she was 13 and is now about to publish her first novel.
I met Charlotte at her publisher's office. She's a bright and confident 15-year-old. Her book is very good and it's hard to believe it was written by someone so young. Charlotte's book talks about big questions and important issues, but she doesn't think she's wise because of her age. She just wanted to explore the idea of taking responsibility.
Charlotte didn't like reading books about teenagers that made them seem weak or stupid. She wanted to write about someone who is fine, not someone who is struggling. She thinks some writers make teenagers feel like they're not good enough because they're not experienced enough.
Charlotte likes reading fantasy books, but they made her feel like she couldn't write a good book. She did find a helpful book called How Not to Write a Novel, which told her to make sure the reader doesn't guess what's going to happen. Charlotte's parents are journalists, which helped her get her book published. She knows she was lucky, but she also thinks that after you get a chance, you have to work hard to be a good writer.

'Our instructor, Gareth, told us, "Speed is your friend, not your enemy." We were about to try freestyle skiing for the first time. One of my friends, David, went first. He went too fast and fell. Gareth said, "Speed is an unpredictable beast." I wasn't sure if I was good enough for this. On our previous skiing holidays, I liked doing simple turns in the snow. I didn't think I was good enough to do the tricks that teenagers do on ramps and half pipes.
My parents decided we would go to a special ski centre in the US where we could learn freestyle skiing. The centre had a big indoor area with trampolines and ski jumps covered in artificial snow. Students would jump and try new tricks, then land in foam cubes. After practicing indoors, we went outside to try it for real. Gareth told us, "Progression is inevitable!" He said that before, people would just try the jumps and hope for the best, but now we can learn to control our movements.
I found it hard to go fast enough to jump properly. My legs would stop moving when I got close to the jump, so I would fall. Gareth told us, "You need to control the jump, not let it control you." On the second day, we practiced on the trampolines. I thought I would hate being indoors, but bouncing on the trampolines was fun. We did some exercises to help us control our movements in the air. Gareth gave us feedback and told us to work on our "aerial awareness". I didn't do very well, but I tried again and again. Finally, I landed properly! Gareth was happy, and I felt proud. But then, on the last run of the day, I lost my skis again.'

Imagine you're on a rollercoaster at an amusement park. Your hands are sweaty and your nails are digging into the safety harness. The ride comes to a stop and then slowly moves upwards. Then, suddenly, it drops and you feel like your stomach is in the air. You might even let out a loud scream. But you chose to ride the rollercoaster, just like millions of other people each year.
It's surprising that amusement parks are so popular, with their scary rides designed to attract crowds. Behind the scenes, there are many experts working together to create the perfect thrill. These experts include engineers, designers, and marketing specialists.
Being a rollercoaster designer might sound like a dream job for a child, but it's actually a big challenge. They need to balance the thrill of the ride with safety, and make sure it's exciting enough to keep visitors coming back. Many people think that rollercoasters have become more intense over time, but most of the techniques used today were invented a long time ago.
I spoke to three experts who work on rollercoasters. They told me that the key to creating a great ride is to make it feel like you're being thrown around, but still feel safe. It's a delicate balance between thrill and safety.
To create the best ride, the teams behind rollercoasters need to come up with a strong storyline, like a space adventure or a jungle chase. They use this storyline to combine different features, like steep drops and sharp turns, to create a seamless experience. However, the experts said that gut instinct, experience, and trial-and-error are what really work.
They also mentioned that being a thrill-seeker can be helpful when designing rollercoasters, as it allows you to understand what passengers want and to test the rides before they open to the public. Some people might think that new technology, like virtual reality, will change the way rollercoasters are designed. However, the experts said that the physical experience of riding a rollercoaster will remain the most important part for many years to come.

Miranda Ellington is a successful choreographer who is 25 years old. She has worked with many theaters and dance companies. She still likes to dance sometimes, even though it's hard to fit it into her busy schedule. As a choreographer, she teaches dance to students and enjoys working with them because they are open to new ideas and willing to take risks.
When Miranda starts working with a new group, she focuses on the dance steps and the music. She has to make sure the dance routine fits the music, even if she doesn't like the music. Sometimes, dancers don't like the music either, but Miranda has to find a solution.
Miranda doesn't like to work with just one company or institution. She likes to work with different people and adapt her style to fit each new group. This means she doesn't get too used to doing things one way and can stay creative.
Miranda thinks that a great dance production is when everything comes together - the music, costumes, lighting, and dancers. It's not always perfect, but aiming high is important. She has worked on productions where something was wrong, like the costumes or props, and that was disappointing.
Some people want to label Miranda as a modern dance choreographer or a ballet specialist, but she doesn't like that. She wants to keep trying new things and not specialize in just one area.
